text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's talk podcast
calm
hello English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 56 in today's
episode I have a new word for you
phobia let's find out what it means and
how you can use it in your daily
conversation phobia do you have a fear
of something in your life and you don't
know what is the cause of such fear
phobia basically means to have a fear of
a particular object or situation a
phobia is a fear which can interfere
with your ability to socialize work or
do your daily activities when you have a
phobia of something or a situation you
avoid facing them even after knowing
they are not harmful or dangerous a
phobia can give you a panic attack or
make you feel totally helpless there are
many types of phobias that include fear
of animal heights crowd and social
events many times a bad experience which
you can't get over develops a phobia
many people have a phobia of water
they are extremely scared to swim or do
any water based activities
this could be due to a bad experience
they have faced in their past most
children fear darkness and are too
afraid to sit in a dark room a person
who has a phobia is known as phobic all
right now that you know what phobia
means let's take a look at some example
sentences to see how you can use it in
your daily conversation
example one dyslexic children should be
given immediate help before they become
school phobic example two after a deadly
bike accident over a wet road I have
become phobic to it I never rode in
monsoons after that as I feel I might
skid even while walking on the road
example three although William loves his
girlfriend too much but hasn't proposed
her for marriage as he has a commitment
phobia example 4 Lisa keeps washing her
hands every hour as she has a phobia of
picking up germs from her surroundings
example 5 due to Peters flying phobia
he couldn't opt for a career in the
aviation industry example 6 Mary told
Marya I have so many phobias but my
worst phobia is of spiders
example 7 samantha has a phobia of
elevators she walks up 15 flights of
stairs daily to get to her office
example 8 when the entire family took
the cable car to reach the mountaintop
John chose to stay away as he had a
phobia of heights
example 9 Ben sleeps with the lights on
as he can't get over his phobia for
darkness example 10 when william was
asked to give a speech in front of the
audience
he stood nervous as he had a phobia of
facing the crowd that's the end of
today's episode I am sure you must be
phobic to something kindly share your
comments below this video explaining
what's your worst phobia and how do you
deal with it thank you for watching us
watch all the episodes of daily video
vocabulary to make your English
communication skills better subscribe to
our YouTube channel and stay updated
with all the latest lessons I will see
you again tomorrow
till then bye and take care
